Wash all vegetables thoroughly with water and chop them.
Finely chop the lettuce and grate the carrot.
Mix all the vegetables in a large bowl.
Add olive oil, lemon juice, and salt, and mix well.
Serve cold.
Chop the onion and carrot, and sauté them in vegetable oil.
Add the tomato paste and continue sautéing for a few more minutes.
Wash the lentils and add them to the pan, stir well.
Add the water and bring to a boil.

Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
Brush a baking dish with melted butter. Lay down the first layer of phyllo dough and brush with more butter. Repeat for 10-12 layers.
Evenly spread the chopped walnuts or pistachios on top of the layered phyllo dough.
Continue layering the phyllo dough and butter, alternating with layers of nuts, until all ingredients are used.
Cut the baklava into diamond or square shapes before baking.
Bake in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until golden brown and crisp.
While the baklava is baking, prepare the syrup: Combine sugar, water, and lemon juice in a saucepan. Bring to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Add honey if desired.
Once the baklava is done, remove it from the oven and immediately pour the hot syrup over the hot baklava. Let it soak for at least 4 hours.
Serve and enjoy your homemade baklava!
